tagline: The world championship nobody asked for. The grassroots OG.

course.terrain_type: Classic Nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads
course.terrain_surface: Loose gravel, some rough minimum maintenance, occasional sand/mud
course.signature_challenge: The heat. August in Nebraska is oppressive. Heat adaptation isn't optional—it's survival.
course.character: Long, hot, and humbling. Nebraska gravel doesn't look hard—until it is.

suffering_zones.label: Heat Onset
suffering_zones.desc: Morning cool is gone. The Nebraska sun starts earning its reputation.

suffering_zones.label: Century Club
suffering_zones.desc: You've done 100 miles. There's 50 more. In August heat.

suffering_zones.label: Mind Games
suffering_zones.desc: Close enough to finish to hurt. Far enough to break.

course.climate_description: August brings humidity, heat, and the kind of Midwest summer that tests your heat tolerance

biased_opinion.summary: Gravel Worlds represents what the sport was before corporate money arrived. It's authentic, community-driven, and legitimately hard. The 'World Championship' name started as a joke but the race earned its reputation through genuine challenge.

logistics.parking: Start area parking is generally available.

searchable_text: Gravel Worlds The world championship nobody asked for. The grassroots OG. Long, hot, and humbling. Nebraska gravel doesn't look hard—until it is. The heat. August in Nebraska is oppressive. Heat adaptation isn't optional—it's survival.
